meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's time to review LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 and I'm thrilled to do it. As a seasonal grok video game reviewer with a penchant for witty humor, I promise you'll have more fun reading my review than actually playing the game (just kidding... sort of).

First off, let me say that the critics are in agreement: this game is all about having fun. And who doesn't love fun? Well, besides maybe the people at IGN, but we'll get to them later.

The biggest selling point for LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 is its sheer scale. With over two hundred characters to play as (or fight against), there's something for everyone. From Iron Man to Captain America, Spider-Man to Thor, you can play as your favorite superhero or villain and smash things up. It's like a digital playground, minus the existential dread of growing up and realizing that adulthood is just a never-ending series of bills to pay.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "But what about the gameplay?" Well, let me tell you, it's as formulaic as they come. You'll collect LEGO bricks, solve puzzles, fight bad guys... yadda yadda yadda. It's all very predictable, but hey, that's kind of the point. This is a game for kids (and kids at heart), not some high-brow art installation.

So, what do the critics have to say? Well, IGN thinks it's "constantly fun" in co-op mode, which is code for "it's great with friends, but meh on your own." GameSpot is more measured, calling it "reverential to its source material" and acknowledging that while it's not perfect, it's still a lot of fun. Gaming Age is a bit more enthusiastic, saying it's "better than the last Marvel LEGO release" (whatever that means).

As for me? Well, I think it's a great way to spend an afternoon (or not, depending on how much you hate your life). It's not going to win any awards for originality or innovation, but sometimes you just want to play as Spider-Man and fight Thanos. And LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 delivers on that front.

In conclusion, if you're looking for a game that's all about having fun (and who isn't?), LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 is a great choice. Just don't expect too much depth or complexity, or you'll be sorely disappointed. But hey, who needs those things when you can play as Captain America and punch Hydra agents? Not me, that's for sure.

Hippo Penny out!
